intro: Kadua cordata subsp. cordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
